elements.title: Battle of the Frogs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1754 Battle of the Frogs was commemorated on banknotes (detail pictured)?

elements.title: International Register of Electors (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as of 2019, inclusion in the International Register of Electors no longer requires residency in Canada in the preceding five years?

elements.title: a propaganda campaign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the United States Department of Defense ran a propaganda campaign against Chinese vaccines during the COVID-19 pandemic?

elements.title: Peewee Jarrett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Peewee Jarrett went from having a two-year span with no playing time and being "set on quitting football" to signing into the National Football League?

elements.title: Wellesbourne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Wellesbourne, Brighton's lost river, stopped flowing in 1889?

elements.title: Max Weil (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Max Weil, founder of the Halifax Symphony Orchestra, spent his later years in real estate?

elements.title: DarkZero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when DarkZero contracted Xynew, his teammates highlighted his "communication skills and game brain", which they deemed unusual for a controller player?

elements.title: Op. 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first public performance of the two songs of Arnold Schoenberg's Op. 1 was met with hostile audience reactions?

elements.title: Score: A Hockey Musical (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Score: A Hockey Musical has been described as "so Canadian it hurts"?
